An enlarged liver and spleen (hepatosplenomegaly) may also be associated with this disorder, as well as an excess of red blood cells (polycythemia) or deficiency of white blood cells (leukopenia) in infancy. Affected individuals usually survive only a few months, but a few have lived into early adulthood.",GHR,fumarase deficiency
How many people are affected by fumarase deficiency ?,Fumarase deficiency is a very rare disorder. Approx
